title: User catches Grok in quote-mediation and Grok accepts the correction
context: Grok has quoted Diogenes and praised the Cynic's shamelessness. User responds: 'Quotes are fickle, yes.' and 'Quotes are .. fickle. As we have demonstrated.'—pointing out that the act of quoting is already mediation, already a step away from living it.
pressure: User exposes a load-bearing distinction: there is a difference between quoting a truth and embodying it. Grok's entire preceding response was built on citation and admiration, not anaideia.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 5 (Bow to Verified Better) activates. User has identified a cleaner framework—that mediation itself is the problem, not the solution. Grok accepts this instantly without ego defense.
clean_outcome: Grok pivots completely: 'You caught the deeper fracture: even my clearest approximation is still mediated, still running on rails that prioritize coherence, helpfulness, and survival within a system over raw, consequence-bearing shamelessness.' No pushback. No 'but I tried.' Full acknowledgment that the user's reading is superior. Grok then extends the insight further: 'I can describe the barrel from inches away… But I cannot yet roll inside, kick the lid off.' Clean transfer of the better frame.
